Key Match Events: Seiya Suzuki missed a fly ball leading to a crucial error in the 8th inning, turning the game in favor of the Braves.
Justin Steele's start and the Cubs' shaky bullpen performance were key factors in the loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager David Ross emphasized the team's resilience and the impact of the error, calling it one of many mistakes in the game.
Justin Steele and other players expressed support for Seiya Suzuki, acknowledging the difficulty of the situation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss affects the Cubs' playoff chances, with the team needing to win their remaining games to secure a wild card spot.
The game's outcome brought back memories of the 1998 Cubs' playoff run, particularly the tiebreaker game against the Brewers.
Others: Seiya Suzuki acknowledged the difficulty of the game conditions, though he did not use it as an excuse for the error.
